intro: Stillingia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
